question: Which is the India's first ever common foundation course for probationer civil servants?
explanation: The Union Government has launched  India\'s first ever common foundation course - “Aarambh” - for probationer civil servants at the Statue of Unity, Kevadia, Gujarat. Around 500 newly recruited bureaucrats are undergoing a 6-day training. Beside this, the Indian Government has also launched the “Nurture the Future” programme. Under this program the civil servants will be divided into teams to visit villages in Kevadia, Gujarat. Each probationer will take a youth under his wing, provide career and professional guidance. The initiative will cover one lakh youth in next 5 years.
